author_ssm: Jasmine Soliman and Jonathan Burr for Akkasah: Center for Photography at NYUAD
unittitle_ssm: Sommerreise in den Nahen Osten (Summer Trip to the Near East)
abstract_ssm:
An album of 130 images taken during a trip through Lebanon, Syria, Jordan and Palestine in August 1966. Images are focussed on historical and religious sites, the final few pages appear to be taken in Germany. 

The album was compiled by Paul Fischer. Fischer was a (German) soldier in World War I who worked on the Berlin–Baghdad railway (Bagdadbahn) for the firm Philipp Holzmann (Frankfurt am Main). After World War I he was a prisoner of war (Kriegsgefangener) in Turkey, after his release and back in Germany he married Anna Liebing (maiden name) in 1.10.1927. He died in East Germany.
